criteria.name: Market Growth Rate
criteria.description: The annual growth rate of the technology hardware, storage, and peripherals market.
criteria.reason: High market growth indicates strong demand and innovation potential.

data_points.name: Annual Revenue Growth
data_points.description: The percentage increase in annual revenues of major companies.

normalized_data_points.name: Market Growth Index
normalized_data_points.formula: Current Year Revenue / Previous Year Revenue

key_points: Analyze historical growth trends to predict future performance.
Consider external market factors influencing growth.
Evaluate competitor growth rates for benchmarking.
Identify emerging technologies affecting growth.
Monitor shifts in consumer demands.

charts.usage: A line chart effectively illustrates market growth trends over time, making it easy to visualize progress and forecast future performance.
A bar chart can compare the annual revenue growth rates of different companies, highlighting market leaders.

criteria.name: Innovation Rate
criteria.description: The frequency of new product launches and innovations within the industry.
criteria.reason: A high innovation rate demonstrates a company's competitiveness and capability to adapt.

data_points.name: Number of Product Launches
data_points.description: Count of new products launched annually by major companies.

normalized_data_points.name: Innovation Index
normalized_data_points.formula: Number of New Products / Total Products

key_points: Assess the impact of innovative products on sales.
Track patents and R&D spending.
Identify trends in consumer technology needs.
Monitor competitor innovation strategies.
Evaluate the sustainability of innovations.

charts.usage: A pie chart can effectively illustrate the proportion of new product categories launched versus the total product categories available.
A scatter plot can show the relationship between R&D investments and number of innovations, identifying correlation trends.

criteria.name: Profit Margins
criteria.description: The profitability of companies in the technology hardware, storage, and peripherals industry.
criteria.reason: Higher profit margins can indicate a company's operational efficiency and brand strength.

data_points.name: Gross Profit Margin
data_points.description: Percentage representing the difference between revenue and cost of goods sold.

key_points: Analyze profit margin trends over time.
Understand cost structure behind products.
Benchmark margins against competitors.
Identify factors impacting profit margins.
Examine pricing strategies of the companies.

charts.usage: A bar chart can show the profit margins of various companies, allowing for easy comparison across the industry.
A line chart can track profit margins over time to indicating company performance and market trends.

criteria.name: Customer Satisfaction
criteria.description: Indicators of customer satisfaction and product usability in technology hardware.
criteria.reason: High customer satisfaction drives repeat purchases and brand loyalty.
examples: Net Promoter Score for gaming mice

data_points.name: Net Promoter Score (NPS)
data_points.description: Measurement of customer loyalty and likelihood of recommendations.

normalized_data_points.name: Customer Satisfaction Index
normalized_data_points.formula: Number of Satisfied Customers / Total Customers

key_points: Review customer feedback data regularly.
Investigate common customer complaints.
Gauge the impact of customer service on satisfaction.
Analyze competitive customer satisfaction ratings.
Identify improvement areas based on customer feedback.

charts.usage: A radar chart can illustrate various aspects of customer satisfaction across different products, allowing for a comprehensive view of strengths and weaknesses.
A bar chart can compare NPS scores of different companies to quickly assess market leaders.

criteria.name: Supply Chain Efficiency
criteria.description: The effectiveness and reliability of supply chain operations.
criteria.reason: Efficient supply chains contribute to lower costs and improved delivery times.

data_points.name: Supply Chain Lead Time
data_points.description: Time taken from order to delivery of products.

normalized_data_points.name: Supply Chain Efficiency Ratio
normalized_data_points.formula: Total Delivery Time / Number of Deliveries

key_points: Assess the impact of supply chain delays on sales.
Identify key suppliers and their performance.
Monitor logistics costs and efficiency.
Evaluate inventory management practices.
Consider emerging risks in global supply chains.

charts.usage: A histogram can reveal distribution patterns of delivery times, helping identify areas for improvement.
A line chart can track trends in supply chain efficiency over time, indicating improvement or deterioration.

criteria.name: Market Share
criteria.description: The percentage of total sales within the market captured by each company.
criteria.reason: Greater market share typically means stronger competitive positioning.

data_points.name: Total Industry Sales
data_points.description: Total sales generated by all companies in the market.

key_points: Track market share changes over time.
Investigate factors contributing to market share shifts.
Evaluate strategies for increasing market share.
Understand competitors’ market positioning.
Monitor market entry of newcomers.

charts.usage: A stacked bar chart can depict market share changes among different competitors, showcasing shifts over time.
A pie chart can show the market share composition of the top companies, illustrating dominance within the market.

criteria.name: Brand Recognition
criteria.description: The extent to which the market recognizes and trusts brands in this industry.
criteria.reason: Strong brand recognition can lead to increased consumer trust and loyalty.

data_points.name: Brand Trust Score
data_points.description: Score reflecting how much consumers trust the brand.

key_points: Monitor changes in brand trust over time.
Investigate marketing initiatives' effectiveness.
Evaluate the impact of brand partnerships.
Understand consumer perception of brand value.
Analyze competitor brand strength.

charts.usage: A line chart can track brand trust score changes over time against competitors, highlighting shifts in consumer perception.
A bar chart can compare brand recognition scores among various companies, allowing for a clear competitive analysis.
